page.title: 17HEATHROW AIRPORT
page.content: HEATHROW AIRPORT REALLY BEGAN IN 1929 WITH RICHARD FAIREYS GREAT WEST AERODROME.DURING THE SECOND WORLD WAR BOMBERS AND TRANSPORT AIRCRAFT BEGAN TO USE THE AIRPORT.IT WAS IN 1944 THAT THE IDEA OF A LARGE COMMERCIAL AIRPORT BEGAN.BY THE END OF 1945 THE FIRST MAIN RUNWAY AND SOME BUILDINGS HAD BEEN COMPLETED.ON JANUARY 1ST 1946 A BRITSH SOUTH AMERICAN AIRWAYS PLANE TOOK OFF FOR BUENOS AIRES.BY MAY OF THE SAME YEAR BOAC HAD OPERATED THEIR FIRST FLIGHT. HEATHROW WAS FORMALLY OPENED ON MAY 31ST 1946.
